title: Man who executed ex-wife's family has been sentenced to be executed
text:
Ronald Haskell was sentenced to death for killing six members of the Stay family. (Picture: AP)

A spree killer who murdered his ex-wife’s family execution-style has been sentenced to death.

On Friday, jurors heard closing arguments at the sentencing hearing of Ronald Haskell, who was convicted of murdering his ex-wife Melanie’s sister, Katie Stay and her husband Stephen, as well as their children, Bryan, 13, Emily, 9, Rebecca, 7, and Zach, 4, in Spring, Texas in July 2014.

Haskell barged into the Stay’s family home dressed as a FedEx deliver driver and killed all but one member of the family to get revenge on his ex-wife. The only survivor was 15-year-old Cassidy Stay, who was also shot in the head, but survived and played dead until Haskell left.

Prosecutor Samantha Knecht said: ‘It’s not a coincidence that he picked July 9, 2014 to go to the Stay’s house. It’s one year to the day and time he was served with a protective order. That’s when the revenge in his heart began to grow.’

Haskell was found guilty of capital murder in September after jurors hear harrowing testimony from Cassidy.

Cassidy said she didn’t immediately recognize her ‘Uncle Ronnie,’ but after she did, she begged him: ‘Please don’t hurt us,’, telling the court that she knew ‘how awful he was.’

Haskell was reportedly armed with a handgun that he outfitted with a home silencer made out of a pillow. Cassidy, whose parents were not yet home, said she tried to soothe her siblings by putting on a Netflix show after Haskell ordered them into the living room.

The teen then tried to ‘appeal to his humanity’ by telling Haskell her siblings’ names and ages, saying ‘I didn’t think someone would hurt kids.’

Katie and Stephen Stay then returned home and Haskell ordered them to join their children in the living room.

Haskell made the Stay family lie face down, tied them up, and began shooting them one by one.

Haskell allegedly tied up and executed six members of the Stay family (Picture: Reuters)

‘Boom, boom, boom,’ Cassidy said, recalling the final moments of her family’s life. Miraculously, Haskell’s bullet only grazed her head and she went limp, surrounded by her murdered loved ones.

‘The room smelled like blood. It tasted sour. There was no spirit in that room,’ she said during her testimony.

Haskell was arrested after a long police standoff while he was reportedly on his way to Cassidy’s grandparents house.

Lawyers representing Haskell argued that he did not deserve the death penalty because he is mentally ill, claiming he snapped amid a psychotic break.
description: Ronald Haskell has been sentenced to death for killing six members of the Stay family in a act of revenge against his ex-wife.
